title: Does anyone have any idea yet how the scorecards ACTUALLY work?
body:
I just finished a game where I primarily backdoored from top lane, I grouped a few times and most importantly right at the end when we pushed for the win, and only got a B+, yet both my team and the enemy team gave credit for the win to me, however I only get a measly B+.

I got first damage taken, second damage dealt, 5th overall damage to enemy and SIX towers plus 2 inhibitors and the nexus kill. The only real downside to my game was my KDA, Gold and CS. My top lane opponent at one point was 5/1, I managed to keep him there and end at 5/7.

It is stupid, I do what is needed to be done and take out the objectives, but because I don't get as good a KDA, gold (or whatever Riot wants to work out) as other Nasus players in the game, I get a bad score.

TL;DR - The players in the game attributed my back door to winning the game, yet due to Riot's metrics, I get a bad score, fair or not?

replies.body: The more popular the champ in that roll the harder it is to score any s rank.

It shouldn't be though since each INDIVIDUAL game is different and therefore you may end up being either countered in your pick, or grouped with players who can't play, they should look not only at the stats of that champion across all ranks, MMR or whatever, but what YOU do in YOUR game.

I had a game where I went 12/5 in Dominion and got shit CS, the game ended in 12 minutes, I had one kill per minute, but because I got no CS, no gold and 5 deaths, I only got an A.

I had a 15 minute SR game, 9/1 and low CS and gold, just not enough time to farm, and got a bad scorecard.

On the flip side I have had games where I got bad KDA and damage dealt, yet due to the game lasting forever I got great CS, lots of gold and a good scorecard.

It is too easy to get a good scorecard if you really wanted to, but I am trying to show that if you play the right way, most of the time you will never get a good score.

He is refering to say playing a champ like Garen in a stupid role like ADC. If you are trying really hard and do decently well, the system won't have many Garen ADCs to compare you against, and most of them were probably feeding trolls anyway, which would inflate your rating.

I mean I only got mastery 6 on Yasuo because I only played Yasuo as an ADC for a very long time and I was not godlike but very consistant with stupid high farm. All those other Yasuo ADCs aren't mains and are just "trying it out" or mucking around, making it very easy to get S ranks.

And that is why I am saying we should have the individual scores for each game you play in with no or little comparison to other players using the same champ.

I could go AD Garen in top lane and go for broke, it works, but should I? Will it give me the best chance to win? Will it be the best option for the team? Of course not, but players do it because they realise it gives them what they want, not what is needed in that game for the team, which is also why players take Ekko, Teemo, Vayne and so on in the top lane, they get what they want, a good end game champ who can give them an S scorecard.

> And that is why I am saying we should have the individual scores for each game you play in with no or little comparison to other players using the same champ.

Then the system would favor champions over others, and people would get easy S ranks on OP champs and struggle with getting an S on Nunu.

> I could go AD Garen in top lane and go for broke, it works, but should I? Will it give me the best chance to win? Will it be the best option for the team? Of course not, but players do it because they realise it gives them what they want, not what is needed in that game for the team, which is also why players take Ekko, Teemo, Vayne and so on in the top lane, they get what they want, a good end game champ who can give them an S scorecard.

Winning helps with rating as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Buttsubushi,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=Ayqhe7Wl,comment-id=00020000000000010000,timestamp=2016-07-27T10:13:23.574+0000)
>
> Then the system would favor champions over others, and people would get easy S ranks on OP champs and struggle with getting an S on Nunu.

Ah but you are wrong, I have proven this before.

I have made a spreadsheet that gives a score for each stat in the game, and I mean every stat, not just focusing on kills and CS like Riot are doing and unlike Riot, I placed stats like assists and even deaths above kills. I actually had kills near the bottom of importance and had damage dealt, damage taken and turrets even above damage to enemy champions, which I had above kills.

You see, the ones who actually play the game, those who care to bother knowing what actually needs to be done to win, we know what stats matter, Riot don't. I think Riot have their head to far up Masters and Challengers ass to realise how the game should be working now.

Getting kills is the last thing we should be focusing on. I can go into a game and get triple or quadruple the damage of anyone on the map, I have even had those rare games where I got triple damage against EVERYONE ELSE IN THE GAME combined. But I got a shit scorecard, why? My CS and Kills where down.

Let me ask you this, if you were to go Nunu (or better yet Voli) on full man mode against 5 enemy AD, all you would be doing is building armour and health, right? That means you would survive everything and can tank all day every day, therefore you should, if playing right, tank more damage than both world wars combined. But currently as it stands, if you get low CS and kills, you get no recognition from Riot for the effort.

If you use my formulas, and again I have proven this before, you WILL get recognised since your damage taken would be that much higher, and if done right you will have tons of assists in comparing your stats against NINE other players, not 900,000 other players, and therefore you get a better overall score (scoring system on my spreadsheet), the game will recognise this and you will get a better scorecard.

I just had a game as Teemo on TT, I played, average at best, but I got an A, how? I got enough kills and CS since we dragged the game out long enough to at least try to have some fun. I mean, the game was over at like 10 minutes, I decided not to group with my team ever just to not have a 15 minute game, and therefore rorted Riots system and got myself a decent scorecard.

>I have made a spreadsheet

link?

>we know what stats matter, Riot don't.

And they are?

>Getting kills is the last thing we should be focusing on. 

Nope. Dead enemies = more towers + more farm + more objectives + more gold + better chance of your team winning. However Assists and Kills should be equal IMO. FOR EVERY ROLE. 

>Let me ask you this, if you were to go Nunu (or better yet Voli) on full man mode against 5 enemy AD, all you would be doing is building armour and health, right? That means you would survive everything and can tank all day every day, therefore you should, if playing right, tank more damage than both world wars combined. But currently as it stands, if you get low CS and kills, you get no recognition from Riot for the effort.

Building to counter the other team means you will die less, and get more assists and kills in teamfights. Which is what you need to do in order for your team to win. And Riot gives you less ratings for dieing less and getting more kills and assists. And to become more tanky sooner, you will need to have high CS.

>I just had a game as Teemo on TT

Plz just keep this to SR only. The rating system for RGM and TT/ARAM is a joke and everyone knows it, Riot doesn't even give 6/7 tokens for S ranks in these game modes. There is no where near close to the amount of data that is used for SR ratings. There is an established 5 roles and an elo system that have been used for years on SR.

Ive been playing yorick supp/jngl for the past 2 weeks, i started off at mastery 2 as i'd played him top a little bit in the past and im now 1 token off mastery 7

Feelsgoodman.
It is what it is. Cant really do much other than cater to getting a better score , so try and improve cs,warding and keeping a positive kda

So instead of trying to win, I should simply go for broke and get that S scorecard?

You see, it's dumb. The game cannot recognise what you are actually doing to get the win and instead just rewards you for good stats.
im not disagreeing with you but it is what it is at the moment, whining about it isn't going to get you an s score, improving cs, warding and kda will.

I honestly could not care less about my own personal scorecards, I am trying to raise awareness that is it rubbish and not fair for the general populace, especially those who actually try to play the game the way it should be, by getting objectives and trying to get the nexus.

I have always been one who loves to play with others who just try their best to play well together and get the win regardless of how well you play. But with all the changes Riot are making, it just isn't the way it used to be and is focusing more and more on leaving players behind for yourself or your premade teammates.

i just had a 4v5(we were the 4) game as urgot mid, won the game, went 22/13/16 and got an a

our wukong went 24/6/15 and got an s-

a previous game i played urgot support  went 7/3/8 with 13 cs and got an s+

its just the system, you can't change it.

... I've seen a lot of complaints but that is completely fair. You can play like garbage the whole game but if the enemy gets distracted you can backdoor and win your team the game. It's a good play, but it isn't A or even S worthy.

Yet they contributed my play to the win (including the enemy team), I even planned for the backdoor from about 10 minutes in and just went for it.

It's a good strategy, if you have a decent enough team who can defend, you backdoor and force the enemy to either keep pushing and possibly lose objectives, or go B and defend allowing your team to farm for free and push other lanes.

That is the problem here, legitimate strategies that work will not give you the recognition you deserve due to how Riot work the metrics. I could simply go balls to the wall, go full damage and get tons of kills and CS, yet do nothing else and lose, but get an S, it's stupid.

That's what I've been complaining about, you have to sacrifice strategy at times to get an S. Some people would rather lose than get an S by just farming non stop and ditching their team, but hey it's here and they ain't changing it, people have been complaining for months and months about this, it isn't doing anything.
Yeh I see it all the time, players who would rather farm for 40 minutes before joining the team, you know, ensuring they get their S score before trying to actually do what is needed.

_The only real downside to my game was my **KDA, Gold and CS**._

Slammed, slammed and slammed. The 3 most important things for rating and you did poorly in all. CS is king, followed by gold, followed by KDA. JUST REMEMBER: you don't even have to win the game to get an S+. And I have gotten multiple S+ when I lost the game. Because of CS, Gold and KDA.

Go cry to a red poster, this has been a problem for months.

And there is my point, CS, KDA and gold should not have as much bearing as it does.

I could easily get an S+ in every game I play as long as it lasts long enough and I don't care for the win. I have seen it done, I have done it and it ruins the game. Why should we play out the game for 45+ minutes when it could be over in 25? Just for a good scorecard?

I would like to see the before and after game time on average in each league since this was introduced, no doubt the times would be getting longer and longer given how much some players want to get a good score over actually winning.

errrr mate, it is more about cs per min, and gold per min. A longer game will require you to consistently have high farm and gold, how do you think people get an S when the other team ff@20? 

I can get easy S on graves jungle as long as I get heaps of kill part, force my laners to shove and take early towers even if they don't want to, and farm both jungles and net every vacant lane's CS. It is scummy, but well it works. Unfortunate tho.

Scummy is not even close to what it is, thanks to Riot in what they are doing first with the Dynamic queue and now with the scorecards, players are only playing some games just for the rewards and scores, not to actually play as a team and get the objectives so you can get the win.

Play Ranked for only LP and elo.
Play Normal for champion mastery.

Don't bitch about mastery rating if you are winning ranked games, it isn't the main focus of that queue.

The problem is, players don't think this way, they want good scores all the time so they play to Riots metrics and ruin ranked games.

It makes me angry, not that players are just farming or choosing assassins and going for kills, but that Riot are changing the game to allow this to happen.

I see great players, those can use Vayne the right way, dodge attacks and get lots of damage and kills, but if they do that, generally Vayne sacrifices CS to get an early kill advantage, an early lane advantage, an early tower advantage, cn than roam and help get more kills and push for an easy early to mid game win.

But no, I see those types of players who can also read the map well simply avoiding all fights only so they can farm a ton of CS and get the odd kill that pleases them, in ranked, no thanks to Riot changing the goalposts.

Well if it bothers you so much that people in ranked are trying to get S ranks instead of trying to win, report them then. And if lots of other players think the same you and report rating grinders for not helping to win games Riot will have to change something then, either removing ratings from ranked or make it impossible to get S ranks when on the losing team.

> I could easily get an S+ in every game

S ranks are something like the top 2% of scores. You aren't _supposed_ to get them every game, and they are by no means supposed to be easy to get. That would entirely defeat the purpose. S ranks are meant to be an accomplishment, not an expectation

However due to how Riot has worked their metrics into the scorecards, it is no longer an accomplishment. Go Youtube _**Wood Division**_, you will see players who do not even deserve to be ranked, yet they sit with level 6/7.

It is too easy to get the S score if you wanted it, if you are good enough all you need to do is keep the game going long enough, get your CS, and end the game with either a win or a lose and there is your S. You don't actually need to get the objectives, so you don't need to do what you should be doing and that, is fucked.
sage
Probably because the system looks at your cs,kills and gold earned instead of the objectives you've taken. Unfortunately that's how it works.

League of Legends is a very complicated game, It is quite difficult to monitor and rank actual gameplay, at the moment riot only has the capability to rank you based on raw stats. Hopefully in the future we may see some rewards for pulling off successful combos, or trading objectives and pressuring the map well, but that is a long long way away. For now they should probably buff the points you get for taking objectives though, CS seems to play too big a part in the point system, rewarding players for sitting top and farming all game rather than putting pressure on the map.

As I noted below, I planned for the backdoor, it actually works if you have a decent enough team, that is one that can defend in a 4v5 scenario. If you backdoor the enemy can either lose towers or B to defend and therefore not push, and you are right, if I farmed more instead of trying to win, I would probably have gotten a better score.

I have had games where I went for 45 minutes, got shit KDA but tons of CS and a better scorecard, it's absolutely retarded.
